title: Aside
summary: The aside pattern allows you to create callouts in the body of an article. All theming of asides is achieved using utility classes.

context.content: Use the note aside to provide supplemental information. [A test link](#) for CSS purposes.
A note is just a standard aside.
Use the caution aside to indicate a potential pitfall or complication.
context.title: Caution

context.content: The warning aside is stronger than a caution aside; use it to tell the reader not to do something.
context.title: Warning

context.content: Use the success aside to describe a successful action or an error-free status.
context.title: Success

context.content: Use the objective aside to define the goal of a process described in the body copy.
context.title: Objective

context.content: Use the gotcha aside to indicate a common problem that the reader wouldn't know without specialized knowledge of the topic.
context.title: Gotchas!

context.content: Use the key-term aside to define a term that's essential to understanding an idea in the body copy. Key-term asides should be a single sentence that includes the term in italics. For example, "A portal isâ€¦"
context.title: Key Term

context.content: Use the codelab aside to link to an associated codelab.
context.title: Codelab
